All Rights Reserved. 00004 * 00005 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of 00006 * this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in 00007 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 00008 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of 00009 * the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, 00010 * subject to the following conditions: 00011 * 00012 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all 00013 * copies or substantial portions of the Software. 00014 * 00015 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 00016 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS 00017 * FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR 00018 * COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER 00019 * IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN 00020 * CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. 00021 * 00022 * http://www.FreeRTOS.org 00023 * http://aws.amazon.com/freertos 00024 * 00025 * 1 tab == 4 spaces! 00026 */ 00027 00028 00029 /* 00030 * Message buffers build functionality on top of FreeRTOS stream buffers. 00031 * Whereas stream buffers are used to send a continuous stream of data from one 00032 * task or interrupt to another, message buffers are used to send variable 00033 * length discrete messages from one task or interrupt to another. Their 00034 * implementation is light weight, making them particularly suited for interrupt 00035 * to task and core to core communication scenarios. 00036 * 00037 * ***NOTE***: Uniquely among FreeRTOS objects, the stream buffer 00038 * implementation (so also the message buffer implementation, as message buffers 00039 * are built on top of stream buffers) assumes there is only one task or 00040 * interrupt that will write to the buffer (the writer), and only one task or 00041 * interrupt that will read from the buffer (the reader). It is safe for the 00042 * writer and reader to be different tasks or interrupts, but, unlike other 00043 * FreeRTOS objects, it is not safe to have multiple different writers or 00044 * multiple different readers. If there are to be multiple different writers 00045 * then the application writer must place each call to a writing API function 00046 * (such as xMessageBufferSend()) inside a critical section and set the send 00047 * block time to 0. Likewise, if there are to be multiple different readers 00048 * then the application writer must place each call to a reading API function 00049 * (such as xMessageBufferRead()) inside a critical section and set the receive 00050 * timeout to 0. 00051 * 00052 * Message buffers hold variable length messages. To enable that, when a 00053 * message is written to the message buffer an additional sizeof( size_t ) bytes 00054 * are also written to store the message's length (that happens internally, with 00055 * the API function). sizeof( size_t ) is typically 4 bytes on a 32-bit 00056 * architecture, so writing a 10 byte message to a message buffer on a 32-bit 00057 * architecture will actually reduce the available space in the message buffer 00058 * by 14 bytes (10 byte are used by the message, and 4 bytes to hold the length 00059 * of the message). 00060 */ 00061 00062 #ifndef FREERTOS_MESSAGE_BUFFER_H 00063 #define FREERTOS_MESSAGE_BUFFER_H 00064 00065 /* Message buffers are built onto of stream buffers. */ 00066 #include "stream_buffer.h" 00067 00068 #if defined( __cplusplus ) 00069 extern "C" { 00070 #endif 00071 00078 typedef void * MessageBufferHandle_t; 00079 00080 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00081 00138 #define xMessageBufferCreate( xBufferSizeBytes ) ( MessageBufferHandle_t ) xStreamBufferGenericCreate( xBufferSizeBytes, ( size_t ) 0, pdTRUE ) 00139 00204 #define xMessageBufferCreateStatic( xBufferSizeBytes, pucMessageBufferStorageArea, pxStaticMessageBuffer ) ( MessageBufferHandle_t ) xStreamBufferGenericCreateStatic( xBufferSizeBytes, 0, pdTRUE, pucMessageBufferStorageArea, pxStaticMessageBuffer ) 00205 00303 #define xMessageBufferSend( xMessageBuffer, pvTxData, xDataLengthBytes, xTicksToWait ) xStreamBufferSend( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer, pvTxData, xDataLengthBytes, xTicksToWait ) 00304 00407 #define xMessageBufferSendFromISR( xMessageBuffer, pvTxData, xDataLengthBytes, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) xStreamBufferSendFromISR( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer, pvTxData, xDataLengthBytes, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) 00408 00495 #define xMessageBufferReceive( xMessageBuffer, pvRxData, xBufferLengthBytes, xTicksToWait ) xStreamBufferReceive( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer, pvRxData, xBufferLengthBytes, xTicksToWait ) 00496 00497 00596 #define xMessageBufferReceiveFromISR( xMessageBuffer, pvRxData, xBufferLengthBytes, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) xStreamBufferReceiveFromISR( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer, pvRxData, xBufferLengthBytes, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) 00597 00616 #define vMessageBufferDelete( xMessageBuffer ) vStreamBufferDelete( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer ) 00617 00633 #define xMessageBufferIsFull( xMessageBuffer ) xStreamBufferIsFull( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer ) 00634 00649 #define xMessageBufferIsEmpty( xMessageBuffer ) xStreamBufferIsEmpty( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer ) 00650 00672 #define xMessageBufferReset( xMessageBuffer ) xStreamBufferReset( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer ) 00673 00674 00694 #define xMessageBufferSpaceAvailable( xMessageBuffer ) xStreamBufferSpacesAvailable( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer ) 00695 00713 #define xMessageBufferNextLengthBytes( xMessageBuffer ) xStreamBufferNextMessageLengthBytes( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00714 00752 #define xMessageBufferSendCompletedFromISR( xMessageBuffer, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) xStreamBufferSendCompletedFromISR( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) 00753 00792 #define xMessageBufferReceiveCompletedFromISR( xMessageBuffer, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) xStreamBufferReceiveCompletedFromISR( ( StreamBufferHandle_t ) xMessageBuffer, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) 00793 00794 #if defined( __cplusplus ) 00795 } /* extern "C" */ 00796 #endif 00797 00798 #endif /* !defined( FREERTOS_MESSAGE_BUFFER_H ) */
